noun.description: Two individuals of the same sort considered together.
examples: a couple of girls were playing marbles

noun.description: Two people who are married, engaged, or otherwise closely associated romantically or sexually.

examples: he hoped she'd be better in a couple of days
we got some eggs—would you like a couple?
clean the stains with a couple squirts of dishwashing liquid
a sense of hope is coupled with a palpable sense of loss

origin: Middle English: from Old French cople (noun), copler (verb), from Latin copula (noun), copulare (verb), from co- together + apere fasten. Compare with copula and copulate.
